lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ted/Ted.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ted.Ted.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents a task bot called Ted. A Ted object interacts with user
* and keeps track of user's tasks.
* Creates Ted object to interact with user and keep track of tasks.
* @param filePath path to file with saved task list data.
* @param fileName name of file with saved task list data.
* Represents the bot's add command. A AddCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is added.
* Creates AddCommand object to add a specific task into the TaskList.
* @param task task to be added into bot TaskList.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is added.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents the bot's bye command. A ByeCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when user exits the bot program.
* Executes the necessary operations when user exits the program.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents commands that users can input to the bot.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException;
* Represents the bot's delete command. A DeleteCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is deleted.
* Creates DeleteCommand object pertaining to a specific task in the TaskList.
* @param taskIndex the task in the TaskList to be deleted.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is deleted.
* @throws TedException if error occurs while deleting task or updating file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents the bot's find command. A FindCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when tasks from TaskList need to be found.
* Creates FindCommand object pertaining to a specific keyword to be searched for
* @param keyword the keyword to be searched for in TaskList.
* Executes the necessary operations when find is called by user.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents the bot's list command. A ListCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when TaskList is to be listed.
* Executes the necessary operations when list is called by user.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents the bot's mark command. A MarkCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is marked.
* Creates MarkCommand object pertaining to a specific task in the TaskList.
* @param taskIndex the task in the TaskList to be marked.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is marked.
* @throws TedException if error occurs while marking task or updating file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents the bot's unmark command. A UnmarkCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is unmarked.
* Creates UnmarkCommand object pertaining to a specific task in the TaskList.
* @param taskIndex the task in the TaskList to be unmarked.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is unmarked.
* @throws TedException if error occurs while unmarking task or updating file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException {
* Returns boolean indicating whether to exit program.
* @return boolean indicating exit status of program.
* Represents exceptions that arise from the use of the bot.
* Creates TedException object with specific error message.
* Represents a parser for decoding user commands. Parser calls the
* correct Command according to the user input.
* Returns a Command object based on the parsed user input command.
* @return Command object to be executed by the bot.
* @throws TedException if user input command does not exist.
public static Command parse(String command) throws TedException {
throw new TedException("Oh no, I don't understand T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, I don't understand T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please indicate task to mark T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please indicate task to unmark T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please indicate task to delete T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please include task description T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please include task description T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please include both deadline description and time T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please include task description T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please include both event description and time T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, I don't understand T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please indicate task to mark/unmark/delete with a number T_T\n");
throw new TedException("Oh no, please input the date in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm format T_T\n");
* Represents storage of task list. A Storage object corresponds
* to a saved file with the specific filePath.
* Creates Storage object with filePath of file with saved tasks.
* Returns TaskList after loading task data from file.
* @return TaskList with tasks saved in file.
* Updates file when changes occur to tasks in the file.
* Represents task with a deadline. A Deadline object corresponds to a task description
* and task deadline given by the user.
* Creates Deadline object with default not done status.
* Creates Deadline object that is specified to be done or not done.
* @param isTaskDone boolean indicating task's done status.
public Deadline(String taskDescription, boolean isTaskDone, String taskDeadline) {
* Returns Deadline in the correct String format for bot response.
* Returns Deadline in the correct String format to write to file.
* Represents an event. An Event object corresponds to an event description
* and event date given by the user.
* Creates Event object with default not done status.
* Creates Event object that is specified to be done or not done.
* @param isTaskDone boolean indicating task's done status.
public Event(String taskDescription, boolean isTaskDone, String eventTimePeriod) {
* Returns Event in the correct String format for bot response.
* Returns Event in the correct String format to write to file.
* Represents a task. A Task object can be one of three types,
* Creates Task object with default not done status.
* Creates Task object that is specified to be done or not done.
* @param isTaskDone boolean indicating task's done status.
* Returns Task in the correct String format for bot response.
* Returns Task in the correct String format to write to file.
* Represents list of tasks. A TaskList object corresponds to the tasks saved
* to the bot by the user.
* Creates Tasklist object with pre-existing tasks.
* @param tasks arraylist of tasks to be inserted into TaskList object.
* Returns number of tasks in the TaskList.
* Returns String representation of the list of tasks in the TaskList object.
* Writes tasks in TaskList to file to be saved.
* @param fw FileWriter that writes to file with saved tasks.
* @throws IOException if error is encountered writing to file.
public void writeToFile(FileWriter fw) throws IOException {
* Returns String representation of task marked.
* @param i task in TaskList to be marked.
* @throws TedException if i index is out of bounds of the TaskList.
public String markTask(int i) throws TedException {
throw new TedException("Oh no, there's no such task T_T\n");
* Returns String representation of task unmarked.
* @param i task in TaskList to be unmarked.
* @throws TedException if i index is out of bounds of the TaskList.
public String unmarkTask(int i) throws TedException {
throw new TedException("Oh no, there's no such task T_T\n");
* Returns String representation of task added to TaskList.
* @param t Task object to be added to TaskList.
* Returns String representation of task deleted from TaskList.
* @param i task in TaskList to be deleted.
* @throws TedException if i index is out of bounds of the TaskList.
public String deleteTask(int i) throws TedException {
throw new TedException("Oh no, there's no such task T_T\n");
* Returns String representation of the list of tasks in the TaskList object
* @param keyword keyword to be searched for in TaskList.
String temp = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
* Represents task to do. A Todo object corresponds to a task description
* that needs to be done given by the user.
* Creates Todo object with default not done status.
* Creates Todo object that is specified to be done or not done.
* @param isTaskDone boolean indicating task's done status.
* Returns Todo in the correct String format for bot response.
* Returns Todo in the correct String format to write to file.
* Represents the user interaction feature of the bot. A Ui object reads the user input
* Prints out a welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Ted and I'm here to help you keep track of your tasks |._.|\n"
* Prints bot responses in a standard format.
* Prints response to user command to delete task.
public void deleteResponse(String task, int size) {

tedResponse("Done! Task deleted:
" + task + "
remaining task count: " + size + "
");
* Prints response to user command to mark task.
* Prints response to user command to unmark task.
* Prints response to user command to add task.
public void addResponse(String task, int size) {

tedResponse("added to tasklist:
" + task + "
task count: " + size + "
");
* Reads user input and returns it in the form of a string.
assertEquals("Oh no, there's no such task T_T\n", e.getMessage());
